thread.title: 12 Reasons You Should Be Damn Proud Of Your Body After Having A Baby
thread.title_full: 12 Reasons You Should Be Damn Proud Of Your Body After Having A Baby

author: Krista Torres
title: 12 Reasons You Should Be Damn Proud Of Your Body After Having A Baby
text:
View this image ›
Gary Sanchez Productions Your skin stretched because you brought another human being into this world and you should be freaking proud of those damn stretchies.
ID: 10389212 2. If you’re still carrying some extra tummy weight, give yourself a break. View this image ›
Columbia Your stomach stretched to the size of a WATERMELON to fit a human being inside it, and that’s pretty incredible.
ID: 10389313 3. If you’re getting night sweats, think of it as a way to lose weight without exercising. View this image ›
Netflix Totally winning.
ID: 10389549 4. If you notice more spider veins, realize this is just the universe telling you it’s okay to wear sweatpants everyday. View this image ›
Bravo And if you want to wear shorts, people DGAF about some stupid veins.
ID: 10389601 5. If your feet grew a size or two, just embrace it. View this image ›
CW A woman can always use a new pair of shoes.
ID: 10389233 6. If some of your hair starts falling out, no one really notices it except you. View this image ›
NBC And even if they do notice, they’re probably thinking, “Man, she looks super hot with thin hair.”
ID: 10389344 7. And, hey, brag about dem big ole’ titties if you must. View this image ›
NBC Your body made milk on its own. NBD.
ID: 10389429 8. If you’re experiencing some pain down there , think about the fact that your risk of getting ovarian cancer may have been lowered by 20% because you had a baby! View this image ›
youtube.com It’s true, folks. Check it out here .
ID: 10389717 9. And if your breasts are leaking 24/7, think about the fact that breastfeeding is thought to reduce your risk of breast cancer by 20%! View this image ›
SNL YASSSS. Read about this as well here !
ID: 10389726 10. If your skin starts to change, just be grateful you don’t have to experience puberty at 13 again. View this image ›
TV One You’re rockin’ those skin changes, mama.
ID: 10389380 11. If your tastebuds changed, that’s just pregnancy broadening your palate. View this image ›
NBC Look at all those new foods you were missing out on!
ID: 10389449 12. And if you’re peeing a little when you sneeze, just tell everyone it is your new hidden talent. View this image ›
youtube.com Try to do that one, boys.
ID: 10389663 Check out more articles on BuzzFeed.com!
